title.narrative: National Load Dispatch Center Energy Storage, through General Electric Company

description.narrative: This grant funds a feasibility study for Vietnam Electricity (EVN), the state-owned power company in Vietnam, to develop energy storage in Vietnam. This feasibility study will help EVN determine the feasibility of deploying advanced energy storage (i.e. battery energy storage system) technologies to reduce power shortages and the need for additional peak generation in southern Vietnam.

title.narrative: National Load Dispatch Center Energy Storage, through General Electric Company

description.narrative: This grant funds a feasibility study for Vietnam Electricity ("EVN"), the state-owned power company in Vietnam, to develop energy storage in Vietnam. This feasibility study will help EVN determine the feasibility of deploying advanced energy storage (i.e. battery energy storage system) technologies to reduce power shortages and the need for additional peak generation in southern Vietnam. This memorandum serves to revise the Action Memo for the National Load Dispatch Center Energy Storage Feasibility Study.

title.narrative: Technical Assistance - Ho Chi Minh City Integrated Emergency Communications System, through Winbourne & Costas, Inc.

description.narrative: This technical assistance (TA) grant partially funds the development of an integrated Emergency Communications System (ECS) for Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam. The TA will assist the Ho Chi Minh City's Department of Information and Communications (HCMC DIC) and the Ho I Minh City People's Committee to develop a unified and integrated ECS, in order to significantly reduce potential damage and material loss, and decrease loss of life during fire, police, and health emergencies. The TA is being performed on a sole-source basis by the U.S. firm Winbourne Consulting, LLC.

title.narrative: Southern Vietnam Liquefied Natural Gas (LNG) Terminal and Gas-to-Power Project, through KBR, Inc.

description.narrative: This grant funds a feasibility study for Vietnam Electricity, the State-owned power company in Vietnam, to develop the Southern Vietnam Liquified Natual Gas (LNG) Terminal and Gas-to Power Project. The Study will assess the site selection and development of the LNG terminal-including LNG storage, regasification, and related infrastructure-to allow assesment of the use of LNG as a fuel source for power generation and to plan necessary terminal vessel services.

title.narrative: Vietnam Airport Management Training Program, through American Association of Airport Executives

description.narrative: This USTDA-funded Vietnam Airport Management Training Program Reverse Trade Mission will support one training session in Vietnam and another training session in the United States for up to 15 Vietnamese airport managers and aviation officials. The training program will focus on providing technical, managerial and operational training to support airport development and aviation safety in Vietnam. The training program will be provided in coordination with the U.S. Federal Aviation Administration and the U.S.-Southeast Asia Aviation Cooperation Program. This funding in the amount of $52,413 is being added to the Vietnam Airport Management Training Program.

title.narrative: Technical Assistance - Vietnam Air Traffic Management Weather Pilot Technical Assistance, through I.M. Systems Group, Inc.

description.narrative: This grant partially funds technical assistance (TA) for the Vietnam Air Traffic Management Corporation (VATM), Vietnam's air navigation service provider, to evaluate advanced aviation weather forecast capabilities. The TA will support a pilot demonstration of IMSG's Enterprise Integrated Aviation Weather System (eIAWS) solutions suite at the Noi Bai Airport in Hanoi to demonstrate the utilization of advanced aviation weather forecasts to better manage air traffic, particularly during adverse weather events.

title.narrative: Desk Study - Ho Chi Minh City Connected Rail ICT Master Plan, through U.S. Government - Trade and Development Agency

description.narrative: This $8,000 desk study reviewed a preliminary concept proposal for a feasibility study that would focus on the development of the urban railway system under construction and planned for Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam. Based on the results from the study, it is expected that the connected rail model would be used also for information and communications technology (ICT) guidance for the Ho Chi Minh City Management Authority for Urban Railways (MAUR) over six planned metro lines, one monorail system, and two tramways.

title.narrative: Reverse Trade Mission - Airport Operations and Development, through The Webster Group

description.narrative: The objective of this reverse trade mission (RTM) was to build relationships between the Airports Corporation of Vietnam and U.S. airport planning firms and equipment providers. The RTM concentrated on the requirements of known upcoming procurements and projects in Vietnams rapidly expanding aviation sector. A secondary objective for this RTM was to advance a USTDA-funded feasibility study on the expansion of the airport in Chu Lai and capture any exports that may arise in relation to this study such as technical consulting services or other airport development procurements.

title.narrative: Reverse Trade Mission - Banking Information Technology Modernization, through MFM Lamey Group, LLC

description.narrative: The Banking Information Technology Modernization Reverse Trade Mission (RTM) provided an opportunity for delegates from major banks in Vietnam to meet U.S. suppliers of advanced banking technology and services. This RTM also provided an opportunity for U.S. companies to learn more about Vietnam's growing commercial banking sector through key decision makers. By connecting the delegates with U.S. companies offering relevant products and services, this RTM aimed to help build greater export business for U.S. firms and help facilitate Vietnam's modernization of its banking systems.

title.narrative: Reverse Trade Mission - Smart Grid Development and Implementation, through Energy Markets Group

description.narrative: The Vietnam Smart Grid Development and Implementation Reverse Trade Mission (RTM) familiarized key power sector officials from Ho Chi Minh City Power Corporation (EVN HCMC) with the latest advances in U.S. smart grid and power transmission technologies and practices and connected U.S. businesses to opportunities in Vietnam. This RTM took place in June 2014 and allowed U.S. industry representatives to enhance their prospects for new U.S. exports through upcoming procurements that EVN HCMC will be pursuing.

title.narrative: Reverse Trade Mission - Wind Power Development, through Koeppen, Elliot & Associates, Ltd.

description.narrative: The Wind Power Development Reverse Trade Mission (RTM) provided an opportunity for wind development officials in Vietnam to meet U.S. manufacturers, suppliers, and engineering consultants and service providers. This RTM also provided an opportunity for Vietnamese delegates to learn more about the successful deployment of wind power in the United States. By connecting the delegates with U.S. companies offering relevant products and services, this RTM aimed to help build export business for U.S. firms and accelerate wind power development in Vietnam.

sector.narrative: Electric power transmission and distribution (centralised grids)

title.narrative: Technical Assistance - Non-Revenue Water Reduction And Wastewater Treatment, through Mendez England & Associates, Inc.

description.narrative: The Non-Revenue Water Reduction and Wastewater Treatment Reverse Trade Mission (RTM) provided an opportunity for water management officials in Vietnam to meet U.S manufacturers, suppliers, and engineering consultants of water and wastewater products and services. This RTM also provided an opportunity for U.S. companies to learn more about the Vietnam water sector through principal stakeholders. By connecting the delegates with U.S. companies offering relevant products and services, this RTM aimed to help build greater export business for U.S. firms and improve water and wastewater management in Vietnam.

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

sector.narrative: Water supply and sanitation - large systems

title.narrative: Technical Assistance - Preparatory Study for the Development of Chu Lai International Airport, through Government of Vietnam

description.narrative: This $538,886 feasibility study determined expansion requirements for the Chu Lai Airport located in the central part of Vietnam, given the expectation that Chu Lai would become a regional air cargo hub and accommodate an expected increase in passenger traffic. U.S. cargo operators, engineering firms, and concessionaires have expressed interest in using Chu Lai as a regional cargo facility, particularly given the growing demands of the industrial sectors in the provinces. Airports Corporation Vietnam (ACV), a state-owned corporation responsible for the airport development, is the grantee.

The assistance will help SAWACO improve its ICT systems and practices to enhance management and operational efficiency in the Ho Chi Minh City water supply system in Vietnam. This project is expected to serve as a model for broader application throughout Vietnam's water ICT sector.

title.narrative: Technical Symposium - Vietnam Environmental Sanitation and Wastewater Treatment Roundtable, through Jacobsen/Daniels Associates, LLC

description.narrative: The Vietnam Environmental Sanitation and Wastewater Treatment Business Roundtable was held in conjunction with a World Bank study tour for senior officials and stakeholders from the Government of Vietnam, as a component of the planned Second Ho Chi Minh City Environmental Sanitation Project, which aims to improve drainage and wastewater treatment in Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam. The Roundtable served the dual purpose of informing U.S. companies about the upcoming project opportunities associated with the wastewater treatment practices, capabilities, and technologies in wastewater treatment. The Business Roundtable was hosted at USTDAs headquarters in Arlington, VA.

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

sector.narrative: Water sector policy and administrative management
Water sector policy and administrative management

title.narrative: Technical Assistance - CAAV AVIATION SAFETY, through Government of Vietnam

description.narrative: This $740,413 technical assistance helps the CAAV make improvements to Vietnam's air safety regulatory system, with the goal of gaining Category I status under the FAA's International Aviation Safety Assessment Program. Obtaining CAT I status would permit direct access by Vietnam Airlines to the U.S. and promote greater investments by U.S. airlines and other aviation organizations in Vietnam's growing air services market. It would also create ongoing partnerships that could lead to continual air safety improvement initiatives.

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Technical Assistance - FLOOD FORECASTING AND EARLY WARNING CAPACITY PILOT PROJECT, through Government of Vietnam

description.narrative: USTDA is providing a technical assistance (TA) grant of $582,853 to Vietnam's Ministry of Agricultural and Rural Development (MARD) to strengthen flood forecasting, early warning and overall disaster management capacity. This assistance provides the MARD with technical solutions, systems integration, and human resources training to achieve its strategic objective of establishing a disaster management information flow and emergency response by linking sensor data collection systems, GIS mapping, scenario modeling, and emergency notification. The Pacific Disaster Center (PDC) is delivering the TA and pilot project using hardware and software contributed by private sector partners such as Sun Microsystems and Oracle.

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - NATIONAL SINGLE WINDOW CUSTOMS PROJECT, through Government of Vietnam

description.narrative: This Feasibility Study helps Vietnam Customs to establish and implement a National Single Window Customs system in anticipation of integrating into a regional ASEAN Single Window effort. The study and subsequent project will facilitate secure trade, increase customs revenue collection, improve the production of international trade statistics, and enhance the effectiveness and accountability of Vietnam's customs administration to support overall trade activities in Vietnam.

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Orientation Visit - ENTERPRISE ARCHITECTURE ICT REVERSE TRADE MISSION, through Business Council for International Understanding

description.narrative: This $250,000 Enterprise Architecture ICT Reverse Trade Mission is designed to introduce senior officials from Vietnam's Ministry of Information and Communications (MIC) to enterprise architecture (EA) and information and communications technology (ICT) systems best practices. This mission supports MIC in their efforts to create an EA framework and focuses on U.S. government EA standards, security procedures, data center management and equipment uses. This RTM will greatly benefit U.S. suppliers who are actively pursuing IT opportunities in Vietnam and see this as the greatest barrier to progress.

title.narrative: Orientation Visit - REVERSE TRADE MISSION: POWER TRANSMISSION BEST PRACTICES AND TECHNOLOGIES, through MFM Lamey Group, LLC

description.narrative: This $251,000 Reverse Trade Mission (RTM) on Power Transmission Best Practices and Technologies is designed to introduce senior officials from Vietnam's National Power Transmission Corporation (NPT) to technology applications, organizational models and management practices of U.S. power transmission companies. This RTM provides delegates with the opportunity to visit U.S. power transmission companies and observe management models and the technologies being employed.

title.narrative: Orientation Visit - VIETNAM: FINANCIAL INFORMATION MANAGEMENT MODERNIZATION REVERSE TRADE MISSION, through Business Council for International Understanding

description.narrative: This $267,000 Reverse Trade Mission on Information Management Modernization is designed to introduce senior officials from the State Bank of Vietnam (SBV) to the U.S. central banking and sector regulation best practices, and ICT systems that manage financial data, accounts, and reports. This visit includes meetings with officials from the U.S. central bank, securities and financial sector insurance systems, the World Bank, and ICT systems providers.

title.narrative: Definitional Mission - Transport Sector, through KED Group, LLC

description.narrative: This $65,000 Definitional Mission (DM) identifies and evaluates opportunities in the transportation sector in Vietnam for USTDA funding consideration. The DM contractor works with Vietnamese entities as well as U.S. companies with interest in the sector to identify at least four activities, preparing scopes of work and budgets, for USTDA funding consideration.

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Definitional Mission - Energy Sector, through U.S. Government - Trade and Development Agency

description.narrative: This $65,000 Definitional Mission identifies and evaluates energy sector opportunities in Vietnam for USTDA funding consideration. Vietnam has recognized that at its current rate of economic growth, its energy demand will outpace its planned energy production capacity by 2015 and has placed high priority on energy efficiency and energy development. As Vietnam continues its rapid economic growth and transitions to become a net energy importer, energy development presents opportunities for USTDA to help encourage greater U.S. company engagement.

participating-org.narrative: U.S. Government - Trade and Development Agency

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - Cloud Computing Data Center, through Government of Vietnam

description.narrative: This $402,675 partially funds a feasibility study to define the market opportunity, strategy, size, scope, implementation plan, and tender process for a Cloud Computing Data Center to be constructed in Ho Cho Minh City, Vietnam. The project provides information technology applications, database, and server resources to Vi Na Group Corporation (VNG) clients and potentially new customers. The study also identifies how the project could be constructed to meet energy efficiency LEED Certified standards and provides the procurement documents required for VNG to acquire all project components. VNG has identified Pathway Systems LLC (PWS) on a sole-source basis, who has agreed to provide a cost share and sign a success fee agreement.

title.narrative: Orientation Visit - Air Traffic Management and Control Systems Reverse Trade Mission, through American Association of Airport Executives

description.narrative: This $283,000 Air Traffic Management (ATM) Reverse Trade Mission (RTM) is designed to introduce senior officials from Vietnam's Ministry of Transportation (MOT) and Vietnam's Air Navigation Services Corporation (VANSCORP) to ATM services, technology and best practices. This mission supports VANSCORP in its procurements for ATM solutions, pursued by Raytheon, Lockheed, Hughes Aerospace and Jeppesen. This RTM benefits U.S. system and service providers, who are actively pursuing ATM opportunities in Vietnam.

title.narrative: Air Traffic Flow Management Implementation Plan, through MITRE Corporation

description.narrative: This 915,348 technical assistance grant partially funds the development of an Air Traffic Flow Management master plan, which would provide a roadmap for deploying advanced U.S. Air Traffic Flow Management tools in Vietnam. The project is expected to increase air traffic efficiency and maintain strong safety practices in Vietnam while facilitating Vietnam's participation in regional Air Traffic Flow Management initiatives. title.narrative: Tan Thuan Nearshore Wind Project, through DNV KEMA Renewables, Inc.

description.narrative: This grant partially funds a feasibility study for the Tan Thuan Intertidal Wind Power Plant for Power Engineering Consulting Joint Stock Company 2. The study will assess the technical, economic and financial viability of developing a 100-megawatt wind farm in southern Vietnam. The project would capitalize on southern Vietnam's strong wind resource, and help expand and diversify Vietnam's power generation mix to meet rapidly growing electricity demands. This memorandum serves to revise the project title for the Vietnam Tan Thuan Nearshore Wind Project FS (Activity No. 2017-31019A).

Electric power transmission and distribution (centralised grids)

title.narrative: IT Strategy And Enterprise Architecture For Smart Grid For Evncpc, through Actionable Strategies, LLC

description.narrative: This technical assistance grant funds an Information Technology Strategy and Enterprise Architecture for Smart Grid for Vietnam's Central Power Corporation (EVNCPC) project that provides for the development of an overall IT and smart grid strategy including an implementation plan to help improve operations. With growing demand for electricity and the need to improve the quality of supply and electricity service to consumers, EVNCPC intends to automate and modernize its IT infrastructure, including implementing smart grid technology and systems to efficiently manage its operations and business processes.

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

sector.narrative: Electric power transmission and distribution (centralised grids)

title.narrative: Global Procurement Initiative: E-Procurement Contractor Performance Database System for Vietnam, through I.M. Systems Group, Inc.

description.narrative: This feasibility study (FS) supports Vietnam's Public Procurement Agency as it develops a contractor performance database system (CPDS), likely as a component of Vietnam's e-government procurement project (E-GP). The FS will be provided as Phase III under USTDA's Global Procurement Initiative Procurement Assistance Program for Vietnam and will assess user needs and functional requirements for a CPDS modeled after the U.S. Contractor Performance Assessment Reporting System. The use of a CPDS is expected to establish a reputable, centralized system for monitoring contractor performance, contributing to a more efficient, transparent, and competitive tendering system in Vietnam.

description.narrative: Global Procurement Initiative: Procurement Assistance Program for Vietnam: Phase I Trainings Technical Symposium

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

sector.narrative: Democracy, Human Rights, and Governance - General

title.narrative: Technical Symposium - GPI: Procurement Assistance Program for Vietnam, through Business Council for International Understanding

description.narrative: The Global Procurement Initiative Phase I activity trained procurement officials and observers over three trainings in Hanoi, Danang, and Ho Chi Minh City, as part of a multi-phased Procurement Assistance Program with Vietnam. The three-day training sessions focused on how to obtain value through the procurement process and coincided with the implementation of Vietnam's revised procurement law, which allows for greater use of best-value determination and objective evaluation methods such as life-cycling cost analysis. USTDA worked with Vietnam's Public Procurement Agency, the George Washington University Law School's Government Procurement Law Program, and the World Bank to carry out the trainings. As the procurement officials incorporate best-value determination and life-cycle costing in their procurement processes on a regular basis, this may increase international competition in public tenders and may help level the playing field for U.S. companies.

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles
